explanations.machine learning: The paper integrates machine learning methods with CNN models for credit score classification.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper uses supervised learning techniques such as KNN, LDA, Naive Bayes, and SVM for classification tasks.
explanations.classification: The primary focus of the paper is on classifying credit scores into good, poor, and standard categories.
explanations.support vector machine: SVM is one of the machine learning algorithms used to reclassify the combined feature set.
explanations.SVM: SVM is explicitly mentioned as one of the methods used for reclassification.
explanations.feature learning: The paper discusses feature extraction from CNN models and merging them into a combined feature set.
explanations.feature representation: The paper transforms 1D sequential text data into 2D greyscale images for feature representation.
explanations.neural network: The paper employs various CNN architectures, which are a type of neural network.
explanations.deep learning: The paper uses deep learning models (CNNs) for feature extraction and classification.
explanations.representation learning: The paper involves transforming data into a different representation (2D images) for better feature extraction.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The paper implements six different CNN architectures for feature extraction and classification.
explanations.CNN: CNN is a central component of the proposed method, used for feature extraction and initial classification.
